rulesofthumb: Minimize bad redundancy, maximize good redundancy
Seek antifragility (Antifragile: Things That Gain From Disorder)
Via negativa. The negative way is a good way. It is good to know what is bad. It is good to know what not to do.
Tell others (document) why you are doing what you are doing.
Avoid analysis paralysis.
Be original, be creative, be constructive but do not reinvent the wheel – in doubt do reinvent the wheel.
Sapere aude! Habe Mut dich deines eigenen Verstandes zu bedienen.
Docere aude! (siehe Barcamp)
Don’t panic!
Think Fast, Talk Smart.
Think Smart, Talk Slow.
Seek Feedback.
Fail-Fast (and hard).
Don’t copy and paste, copy, improve and paste.
Rather change your patterns than your reasons for them.
Don’t expect others to change their patterns. Don’t blame them for not doing so.
People are always more complex than our narratives of them.
Always assume good intentions
If something goes wrong, it was not intended. Period.
Don’t change it, improve it!
Be explicit about your intentions.

rulesofthumb.quote: Auf den Schultern von Giganten. „Wenn ich weiter geblickt habe, so deshalb, weil ich auf den Schultern von Riesen stehe.”
rulesofthumb.author: Newton

rulesofthumb: Manchmal schauen Riesen auch in die falsche Richtung.
Die Leserin hat Recht.
Nichts menschliches ist mir fremd.

rulesofthumb.quote: For every complex problem there is an answer that is clear, simple, and wrong.
rulesofthumb.author: H. L. Mencken

rulesofthumb.quote: Special cases aren't special enough to break the rules.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: In the face of ambiguity, refuse the temptation to guess.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: There should be one-- and preferably only one --obvious way to do it.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: Although that way may not be obvious at first unless you're Dutch.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: Although never is often better than *right* now.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: If the implementation is hard to explain, it's a bad idea.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: If the implementation is easy to explain, it may be a good idea.
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters

rulesofthumb.quote: Namespaces are one honking great idea -- let's do more of those!
rulesofthumb.author: Tim Peters
